designScenario.name: Actuators
designScenario.description: The Actuators system is a hybrid electro-hydraulic and electro-mechanical module responsible for precise control of flight surfaces, landing gear deployment/retraction, and braking systems. It combines hydraulic reliability with electric redundancy to meet modern aviation safety standards. The system integrates adaptive control algorithms, self-diagnostic capabilities, and fault-tolerant architectures to ensure operational integrity under extreme aerodynamic loads, temperature variations, and partial system failures.

details.description: Provide dual-mode actuation (hydraulic primary, electric backup) for flight control surfaces to ensure continuous operation during hydraulic system degradation.
Adjust actuation force output (15-25 kN) in real-time based on aerodynamic load sensors to prevent surface flutter while maintaining ±0.1° positional accuracy.
Implement triple-redundant control signal processing with voting logic to isolate and bypass faulty actuator commands within 50ms.
Embed vibration analysis and fluid particulate sensors to predict bearing wear and seal degradation, enabling maintenance intervals up to 1,200 flight hours.

systemComponents.name: Electro-Hydrostatic Actuator (EHA)
systemComponents.description: Self-contained hydraulic actuator with local electric pump for redundant operation, eliminating centralized hydraulic dependency for critical flight surfaces.

subComponents.name: Variable Displacement Pump
subComponents.description: Electronically controlled swashplate pump regulating fluid flow based on flight control computer demands

subComponents.name: Solenoid Override Valve
subComponents.description: Fail-safe valve isolating actuator from central hydraulic system during EHA mode activation

systemComponents.name: Electro-Mechanical Actuator (EMA)
systemComponents.description: All-electric secondary actuation system with harmonic drive gearing for high-torque applications in flight control surfaces.

subComponents.name: Torque Limiter
subComponents.description: Mechanical slip clutch preventing jamming scenarios by decoupling motor during overload conditions

systemComponents.name: Actuator Control Unit (ACU)
systemComponents.description: Triple-channel FPGA-based controller implementing MIL-STD-1553B interfaces for command processing and health monitoring.

relationships.description: Transmits surface deflection commands via redundant ARINC 825 networks to actuator control units
Primary hydraulic power source for normal operation mode, with automatic isolation during backup activation
EMA units are integral subcomponents providing backup actuation capacity within the Actuators module
Streams actuator performance metrics and prognostic data for fleet-wide maintenance optimization

attributes.name: forceDynamicRange
attributes.description: Adjustable force output range accommodating varying aerodynamic loads during different flight regimes

attributes.name: transitionLatency
attributes.description: Maximum allowable delay when switching between hydraulic primary and electric backup actuation modes

attributes.name: shockTolerance
attributes.description: Mechanical resilience to sudden impact loads during hard landings or turbulence

attributes.name: powerDensity
attributes.description: Power-to-weight ratio for EMA subsystems, critical for minimizing parasitic mass in flight surfaces

attributes.name: EMIRating
attributes.description: Electromagnetic interference immunity level ensuring operation in high-radiation environments
